children.title: What types of announcements can I create
children.content:
You can create three types of announcements:
• Goods — to buy or sell agricultural products or equipment.
• Services — to offer or request agricultural work or services.
• Rent — to rent in or rent out land, machinery, or equipment.

children.title: What happens after I submit an announcement
children.content:
After submission, the system saves your announcement and places it in My Announcements.
Depending on the provided information:
• Some announcements are published immediately.
• Others wait for administrator verification before becoming visible to other users.

children.title: Why is my announcement waiting for verification
children.content: Announcements that include additional details such as description or photos may require administrator review to maintain marketplace quality and trust.

children.title: Can I edit my announcement
children.content:
Yes.
If the announcement is not yet verified, all fields can be edited.
If it is already published, only the availability period can be extended.

children.title: Can I close or cancel my announcement
children.content:
Yes.
Close stops new applications but keeps the announcement history visible and approved applications.
Cancel removes the announcement and cancels all related applications.

children.title: What happens when an announcement expires
children.content:
When the availability period ends, the system automatically closes the announcement.
• New applications are no longer allowed.
• Pending applications are canceled automatically.
• The announcement remains visible in your history.

children.title: Who can see my announcement
children.content: All users can see your published announcements. Users located in the selected regions and villages will also receive notifications about your announcement within the application.

children.title: Why can’t I click Submit
children.content: The Submit button becomes active only after all required fields are completed correctly. If required information is missing or invalid, the button remains disabled.

children.title: Can administrators deactivate announcements
children.content: Administrators may deactivate announcements that violate platform rules or contain incorrect information.

children.title: What is the difference between Close and Cancel
children.content:
Both Close and Cancel stop the announcement and keep it visible in your My Announcements history.
• Close stops new applications. Pending applications are canceled, while approved applications remain approved and the announcement remains visible in history.
• Cancel stops the announcement and cancels all submitted applications.
Frequent canceling of announcements may affect your rating in the future.

children.title: How does automatic closing work
children.content: If the availability period expires and is not extended, the system automatically closes the announcement and informs affected users.

children.title: How do I apply to an announcement
children.content: Open an active announcement, click Apply, fill in the required information, and submit your application.

children.title: Is my application confirmed after submitting it
children.content: No. Applying creates a request only. The deal becomes confirmed only after the announcer approves your application.

children.title: What does “Pending” application status mean
children.content: Pending means your application was sent successfully and is waiting for the announcer’s decision.

children.title: Can I apply multiple times to the same announcement
children.content: No. If you already have a Pending application, you must edit or cancel it instead of creating a new one. If your previous application was Approved or Canceled, you can apply again.

children.title: Can I edit my application
children.content: Yes, but only while the application status is Pending and the announcement is still active.

children.title: Can I cancel my application
children.content: Yes. You may cancel your application while it is Pending or Approved. Frequently canceling approved applications may affect your reliability rating.
